ud3.5:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ud3.5:1.3: Now at that time Venerable Mahāmoggallāna was sitting not far from the Buddha, cross-legged, with his body straight and mindfulness of the body well-established in himself.
ud3.5:1.4: The Buddha saw him meditating there.
ud3.5:2.1: Then, understanding this matter, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ud3.5:3.2: restrained in the six fields of contact,
ud3.5:3.3: a mendicant always immersed in samādhi
